column2: Has NOT requested a boon from §Y[Root.Offmap.Ruler.GetShortMexikhanHuetlatoaniName]§! within the last year\n
Has NOT sent tribute to §Y[Root.Offmap.Ruler.GetShortMexikhanHuetlatoaniName]§! within the last year\n
§Y[Root.Offmap.Ruler.GetMediumMexikhanHuetlatoaniName]§! has NOT granted you a boon within the last year
Paying tribute to §Y[Root.Offmap.Ruler.GetMediumMexikhanHuetlatoaniName]§! is currently available.
Peace Deal With the Lost Colony
The Lost Colony will not attack this ruler while the peace deal is active.

column15: x	# actually created by Moctezuma in the mid 15C.

column2: The Lost Colony is currently open to tribute and interested in acquiring tributaries within its sphere of influence.

The Lost Colony has turned inward and is mostly ignoring its neighbors. All actions to gain the Huetlatoani's Antilytron or request boons are invalid. New Tributary states will likely not be accepted.
§Y*§! Lost Colony will §YNOT§! declare any wars\n§Y*§! The §YSend Tribute§! and §YRequest Boon§! decisions are §RDisabled§!
The Huetlatoani is showing a rare interest in the rest of the world. Lost Colony might aggressively seek to gain new Tributary states, or even stage a major invasion to 'pacify the New World'.

The [Root.GetName] is experiencing a period of internal stability. Without any large-scale disasters or powerful enemies prosperity is able to spread, and the military might of Lost Colony stands ready to defend both its own wealth and its integral territories.

Civil unrest runs rampant in the [Root.GetName], and it has thrown the trade routes with Lost Colony into disarray. Lost Colony's armies are occupied internally in an attempt to keep the peace, and unless the unrest is quelled soon a full-blown civil war may well erupt at any moment.
§Y*§! This Status might result in a §RCivil War§!
Civil war has erupted in the [Root.GetName], and trade with Lost Colony suffers as a result. The Empire's armies are arrayed against one another, and the ruling dynasty itself is threatened.
§Y*§! Imperial Tributaries can Break Free without opposition from Lost Colony\n§Y*§! Might end with Lost Colony getting a §RNew Dynasty§!, resetting all §YAntilytron§!

A disastrous harvest has caused the Lost Colonyn agriculture to buckle under the population. The calamity has caused most trade to cease, and even as their numbers dwindle, the [offmap_mexikha.GetName]'s once-mighty armies have been burdened with relief efforts for the suffering.

The [Root.GetName] has reached untold power and wealth. A Huetlatoani of Lost Colony in this Golden Age may well rightfully consider [Root.Ruler.GetHerselfHimself] the [Root.Ruler.GetMasterMistress] of the known world.
§Y*§! The armies of Lost Colony are significantly stronger

A terrible disease wracks the [Root.GetName], leaving thousands lying dead in its wake. Trade has ground to a halt as the Lost Colonyn economy has been forced to its knees, and even the Empire's armies have been decimated to but a shadow of their former glory.

An enormous warband of Vikings has descended upon Lost Colony from the North. The mighty Lost Colonyn armies are preoccupied with a desperate defense against the fierce invaders. Should the Vikings triumph, it is possible that scions of the current Dynasty may flee with the remnants of their forces.
§Y*§! Might end with Lost Colony getting a §RNew Dynasty§!, resetting all §YAntilytron§!

An enormous Inca army has descended upon Lost Colony from the South. The mighty Lost Colonyn armies are preoccupied with a desperate defense against the fierce invaders. Should the Inca triumph, it is possible that scions of the current Dynasty may flee with the remnants of their forces.
§Y*§! Might end with Lost Colony getting a §RNew Dynasty§!, resetting all §YAntilytron§!
focus on the imperial tomatl gardens
practice the art of manuscript painting
contemplate the wisdom of Master Mon'Roe
divine the secrets of the Tonalpohualli

If the §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetName]§! is amenable to foreign relations you can send an envoy to provide the Huetlatoani with a token of your subservience. Paying Tribute will increase your §YAntilytron§!.

You can take certain hostile actions against the [offmap_mexikha.GetFullName] but be wary as the [offmap_mexikha.Ruler.GetTlatoaniCihuatlatoaniCap] is unlikely to tolerate such behavior. Taking Hostile Actions will likely §RAnger Lost Colony§!.

If the §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetName]§! is amenable to foreign relations, and you have not yet had your appeals heard in the past year, you can send an envoy to request any one of a variety of blessings the Huetlatoani might deem you worthy of. Asking for Boons costs §YAntilytron§!.

Send a request to §Y[Root.Offmap.Ruler.GetMediumMexikhanHuetlatoaniName]§!, asking for peaceful relations with the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! and its §Y[Root.Offmap.Governor.GetTitle]§!. Having a §YPeace Deal§! ensures that the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! does not target your realm should they go on the warpath.

\nDuring the peace deal, the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! and its §Y[Root.Offmap.Governor.GetTitle]§! will not declare war on you. It will last for §Y50§! years or until the dynasty of the [Root.Offmap.Ruler.GetTitle], [Root.Offmap.Ruler.GetOnlyDynastyName], ends.
Does NOT have a non-aggression pact or peace deal with the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! and its §Y[Root.Offmap.Governor.GetTitle]§!\n

In exchange for §R50% income§!, §R30% troop reinforcement rate§! and §R[GetChineseOffmapTributaryPrestigeCost]§!, receive §G2 Antilytron per month§!.\nThese effects last until the end of the Empire's §Yruling dynasty§!, or until §Yyou declare independence§! (through war, or decision in the Intrigue screen).\n
Has a realm county bordering the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]\n
Has a realm county bordering a nation which is a tributary of the [Root.Offmap.GetFullName]\n
Has a realm county bordering Western edge of the map\n
Has a coastal realm county in South-Western Coast of Iberia\n
Does NOT already have a suzerain\n
Has a realm county in the Lost Colonyn Region of Influence\n
Has NOT broken free from being a tributary in 30 years

The §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! is famed for their learned citizens. You can request to have one of these scholars come to your court and serve as your personal physician. This character always has the §YPhysician§! trait.
Does NOT have a Court Physician

The §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! is the cradle of countless wonders of technology. You can request to have a Lost Colonyn master mason join your court. A §YMaster Mason§! will improve your demesne with powerful §GProvince Modifiers§!.
Does NOT have a Master Mason
A master engineer will join your court. While employed, they will build constructions and machines throughout your demesne, adding various bonuses to your economy, military, and technology.
This character is a well of theoretical knowledge used to invent and design all sorts of structures and machines, as well as the practical know-how required to construct them.

column3: This character is a well of theoretical knowledge used to invent and design all sorts of stone structures, as well as the practical know-how required to construct them.

column2: Sloped plane of this province has been cut into a series of successively receding flat surfaces or platforms, which resemble steps, for the purposes of more effective farming.
Telpochcalli were centers where lowborn youth were educated. Students who excelled in skill and courage could someday become distinguished citizens.
The dry dock in the port of this province makes the construction, maintenance and repairs of ships significantly easier.
column3: La cale sèche du port de cette province facilite considérablement la construction, l'entretien et la réparation des navires.
column4: Das Trockendock im Hafen dieser Provinz macht den Bau, die Wartung und die Reparatur von Schiffen deutlich einfacher.
column6: El dique seco en el puerto de esta provincia facilita sobremanera la construcción, mantenimiento y reparación de naves.

column2: A long narrow playing alley flanked by stone walls with both horizontal and sloping, ballcourts were public spaces used for a variety of ritual activities, festivals and, of course, the ballgame.
This artificial pond provides vast body of water, which may be released into canals for use in farmlands

By requesting the Imperial seal our trade posts will attract merchants from far and wide to trade in exotic goods. Having an §YImperial Trade Contract§! will boost the value of your §YTriangular Trade Route Trade Posts§! by §G25§! for §Y25 years§!.
Must have a realm province located on the Triangular Trade Route
All trade post provinces in the realm of §Y[From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]§! gains §G25%§! increased trade income for 25 years.
Favored on the Triangular Trade Route
Thanks to their liege taking control of the Triangular Trade Route, the traders in these lands are enjoying the profits of being favored in all trade deals.

The craftsmen and artists of the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! are famed for creating masterful and beautiful art. You can request to have one of these artifacts sent to you. You will receive a random artifact ranging from quality §Y1§! to §Y3§!.
Does NOT already have all Lost Colonyn artifacts ranging from quality §Y1§! to §Y3§!

The ones truly favored by §Y[Root.Offmap.Ruler.GetMediumMexikhanHuetlatoaniName]§! can, on behalf of themselves or a close relative, request to marry a relative of the Huetlatoani's. Performing an §YImperial Marriage§! will grant you §G500§! §YPrestige§! as well as give you a §GPeace Treaty§! with Lost Colony. The spouse of a Princess or Prince will be able to raise a regiment of §GHonor Guards§! when at war.
A prince of the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! arrives to marry §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!.
A princess of the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! arrives to marry §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!.
This man is a prince of the Lost Colonyn imperial family.
This woman is a princess of the Lost Colonyn imperial family.
You will enter into a peace deal with the §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetFullName]§!.

This marriage will secure a peace deal during which the §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetFullName]§! and its §Y[offmap_mexikha.Governor.GetTitle]§! will not declare war on you. It will last for §Y50§! years or until the dynasty of the [offmap_mexikha.Ruler.GetTitle], [offmap_mexikha.Ruler.GetOnlyDynastyName], ends.

Ask the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! to declare war on another ruler with the intent of shattering their realm. If the war succeeds, any §YKingdoms or Empires§! held by the target will be §Rforcibly destroyed§!. Lost Colony only attacks realms of either §YKing or Empire tier§! which contain at least §Y40 Counties§!, as anything else would be too menial for them.
Does NOT hold a religious head title that is higher tier than §YDuke§!
Has NOT defeated Lost Colony in a war
As you, or one of our unlanded dynasty members that are in your court, are married to a Imperial Princess or Prince, you can raise their Honor Guard to fight for you in your current war.
Has NOT raised the Honor Guard in the past year
Tributaries of Lost Colony can raise a special regiment of Lost Colonyn troops to assist them in defensive wars.
Must NOT have raised a Lost Colonyn Regiment in the last year
Offer up one of your courtiers, to be sent to live out their life in the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§!, in the service of the Huetlatoani.\n
Has an attribute greater than or equal to §Y20§!
Has NOT sent a eunuch in 20 years

As the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! is being ravaged by a devastating plague, you can offer to send a medically-schooled individual to go and protect the Huetlatoani from disease and infection. This interaction can only be taken once per character.
Has NOT sent a physician already
Has NOT sent an artifact in 10 years
Is a high quality artifact (that is NOT cursed or from Lost Colony)
Offer up one of your courtiers, to be sent to live out their life in the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§!, in the service of the Huetlatoani.\n
Has NOT sent a concubine in 20 years
Send a gift of coin to §Y[Root.Offmap.Ruler.GetMediumMexikhanHuetlatoaniName]§!.
Has NOT gifted money to the §Y[Root.Offmap.Ruler.GetShortMexikhanHuetlatoaniName]§! within the last 15 years

The §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! is overburdened with riches - why should we vie for the Huetlatoani's grace when we could just take whatever we want!\n\nTaking this decision will temporarily §Rdisable§! all §YPay Tribute§! and §YAsk for Boon§! interactions for as long as the raid persists, and then five years after that. While Raiding Lost Colony you will lose Antilytron but gain loot and spoils every year, a portion of your soldiers will also be unavailable for the duration of the raid.
This character is currently sending raiding parties to cross the border to Lost Colony, angering the Huetlatoani but bringing home a steady stream of loot each year.
Has NOT raided the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! in the last 5 years[From.GetRaidCD]

Raiding the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! is lucrative, but dangerous - we should withdraw our raiders from Lost Colony.\n\nWe will no longer be considered a priority target, but neither will we be able to raid Lost Colony again for 5 years.

The §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetFullName]§! has isolated itself from the rest of the world. They have closed down trade across the Triangular Trade Route and refuse to deal with any outsiders. §Y[offmap_mexikha.Ruler.GetMediumMexikhanHuetlatoaniName]§! must be forced to reopen their land, by negotiation or if necessary by force.

You will choose a method to open the §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetFullName]§!: Defeating them in §Ywar§!, controlling a §Ystarting point§! of the Triangular Trade Route and §Y25%§! of its wealth or by §Ynegotiating§! a treaty.
This option is available as you control a §Ystarting point§! of the Triangular Trade Route and §Y25% of the wealth§! along it.
You will force open trade along the Triangular Trade Route much to the anger of §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetFullName]§!.
You will negotiate a deal with §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetFullName]§! to open up trade along the Triangular Trade Route.
Will NOT be able to change to the Isolationist Policy for §Y50§! years
Has NOT attempted to force the §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetFullName]§! open in the past §Y15§! years

The §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetFullName]§! is stable and prospering, with the arrogant [offmap_mexikha.Ruler.GetTlatoaniCihuatlatoaniCap] convinced of their invincibility - you will prove them wrong!\n\nInvading Lost Colony is no easy task - you will face the full might of their armies, while suffering a §R75%§! penalty to your §YLevy Reinforcement Rate§!. Winning means placing your §YDynasty§! on the Skull Throne, and you will also receive vast spoils of war. If you lose your realm will be §Rshattered§!!
Has NOT failed an invasion of Lost Colony
All of your current §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetCurrency]§! and §Ymodifiers§! from §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetShortName]§! will be §Rremoved§!.
You have sent vast numbers of your troops to attack the Lost Colonyn heartland.
Has NOT failed an invasion of the §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetFullName]§!
You will NOT be able to interact with the §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetFullName]§!
Has NOT raised any vassal levies

Your [invasion_of_mexikha_claimant.GetRootRelation], §Y[invasion_of_mexikha_claimant.GetBestName]§!, will become the new §Y[invasion_of_mexikha_claimant.GetTlatoaniCihuatlatoaniCap] of Lost Colony§!. Any of their immediate family, who are not landed or the primary heir to a title, will join them on the Subcontinent.\nAny land held by the Northern Rashtras will be transfered to you.

You can declare war against the §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetFullName]§! to free yourself from your status as an §YImperial Tributary§!. If §Y[offmap_mexikha.GetShortName]§! is currently suffering from an §Rinvasion§! or a §Rcivil war§! then you can free yourself via a §Ydecision§! in the intrigue screen.

\nAntilytron is gained by §YPaying Tribute§! to the current Huetlatoani, you can use accumulated Antilytron to §GAsk for Boons§!. Any Antilytron you have accumulated will be passed on to your heir during succession.\n§RAll Antilytron is lost should the Dynasty change in Lost Colony!§!
Is a vassal of the Lost Colony

§L[Root.GovernorTitle.GetAdjective] [Root.Ruler.GetTitle]s have varying interests and tastes. This has a big impact on all actions when trying to gain the [Root.Ruler.GetTitle]'s Antilytron. The [Root.Ruler.GetTitle] takes note both of your own qualities (e.g. Culture) and those of your specific offering (e.g. a Concubine)...§!

Blue indicates realms that are within diplomatic range of the §Y[Root.GetName]§!.
Green indicates realms that have a peace treaty with the §Y[Root.GetName]§!.
Purple indicates realms that are paying tribute to the §Y[Root.GetName]§!.
Red indicates the realm of the §Y[Root.Offmap.Governor.GetTitle]§!.
A tributary of [Root.GetShortGenericName] will be able to raise a regiment of troops when at war, as long as the [Root.GetName] is stable and prospering.
Rulers may sign Peace Deals with the [Root.GetName], to ensure that they will not be the target of an invasion.
Press §GRight Click§! to open Map Mode for $OFFMAP|Y$§G.
You have recently sent a Eunuch to Lost Colony, you will be able to send another one on: §Y[Root.mexikhan_grace_send_eunuch_timer.GetExpiryDate]§!
You have recently sent a Commander to Lost Colony, if Lost Colony is still in turmoil you will be able to send another one on: §Y[Root.mexikhan_grace_send_commander_timer.GetExpiryDate]§!
You have recently sent a Concubine to Lost Colony, you will be able to send another one on: §Y[Root.mexikhan_grace_send_concubine_timer.GetExpiryDate]§!
You have recently asked Lost Colony for a Boon, you will be able to ask for another one on: §Y[Root.ssi_mexikha_boon_cd.GetExpiryDate]§!
You have recently broken free from being a Tributary of Lost Colony. You will be able to ask to become one again on: §Y[Root.mexikhan_grace_tributary_timer.GetExpiryDate]§!
You have recently sent Famine Relief to Lost Colony, if Lost Colony is still suffering from a Famine you will be able to send another expedition on: §Y[Root.mexikha_send_relief.GetExpiryDate]§!
You have recently sent a Gift to Lost Colony, you will be able to send another one on: §Y[Root.mexikhan_grace_send_gift_timer.GetExpiryDate]§!
You have recently stopped Raiding Lost Colony, you will be able to resume raiding on: §Y[Root.mexikha_raid_grace_cd.GetExpiryDate]§!
You have already sent a Physician to Lost Colony, you will not be able to send another one.

Desired by many for its intrinsic value and the beautiful design which displays the height of the [offmap_mexikha.GetFullGenericName], this intricately designed serpent made out of jade by a master [From.OriginalOwner.Culture.GetName] craftsman is a very unique treasure.
column3: Nombreux sont ceux qui le veulent pour sa valeur intrinsèque et son esthétique affichant la grandeur de [offmap_mexikha.GetFullGenericName], ce serpent finement sculpté fait en jade par un maître-artisan [From.OriginalOwner.GetCultureMasc] est un trésor unique.
column4: Von vielen für seinen inneren Wert und das schöne Design geschätzt, wurde dieser kompliziert entworfene Schlange aus Jade von einem meisterhaften [From.OriginalOwner.Culture.GetName]en Handwerker geschaffen und ist quasi ein einzigartiger Schatz.
column6: Deseado por muchos por su valor intrínseco y el hermoso diseño que muestra la altura del [offmap_mexikha.GetFullGenericName], este serpiente intricadamente diseñado de jade por un maestro artesano [From.OriginalOwner.Culture.GetName] es un tesoro único.

column2: Products by masterful [From.OriginalOwner.Culture.GetName] goldsmiths, this turquoise mosaic mask played an important role in both political and religious functions.
The luxury jaguar-skin coat. Worn above a suit of armor.
A hard-wooden club with several embedded obsidian, which is capable of producing an edge sharper than steel blades.
Made with fibers from the exotic plant, it's used to hurl a pebble long distances.
Inside this magnificent box sits the preserved heart of [From.GetBestName].
A skull-shaped sculpture carved in translucent quartz.
A small figurine depicting a former Huetlatoani of Lost Colony. Though small, it has intricate details and shows great craftsmanship.
column3: Une petite figurine représentant un ancien huetlatoani de Mexique. Bien que petite, elle a des détails très élaborés et témoigne d'un grand artisanat.
column4: Eine kleine Figur, die einen ehemaligen Huetlatoani von Mexiko darstellt. Obwohl klein, hat sie komplizierte Details und zeigt große Handwerkskunst.
column6: Una figurita que representa al huetlatoani anterior. Aunque pequeña, tiene muchos detalles y muestra una gran destreza.

column2: The status quo in Lost Colony is over
The period of Unrest in Lost Colony has come to an end and the surviving militant peasants have returned to till their fields
The Great Famine in Lost Colony is finally over
The Pale Rider is done reaping his terrible harvest in Lost Colony and the Devastating Plague appears to have receded
The [offmap_mexikha.GetMexikhanInvader] armies have given up on their ill-fated invasion of Lost Colony
The Lost Colonyn Civil War is over and the last rebel bastion has fallen
The period of Unrest in Lost Colony has dramatically worsened
The Lost Colonyn Civil War is over and the last rebel bastion has fallen, yet the turmoil in the [offmap_mexikha.GetFullName] is not over..
The Lost Colonyn Golden Age appears to be over

the construction of certain Lost Colonyn warship, with fine carvings painted in red, and how they always carry names such as 'We Are His Slaves' or 'Enemy of Both Sides'
a pleasure trip made on a majestic city in a lake, and the magnificent landscape of the Empire
how any water route through a Lost Colonyn city seems to be constantly crowded by traffic, with ships and boats everywhere
how the Lost Colony is so full of life, and there are people everywhere
how the realm is so wealthy, and every inch of the Lost Colony seems to be used to house or nourish its people

The Lost Colony can, by way of war, shatter realms they consider too big for their own good.
The [offmap_mexikha.GetFullName] has been a thorn in our side long enough - no more!

The Lost Colony can, by way of war, force realms to submit to them.
This character has captured a pair of jaguars and is keeping them as pets.
A favored item from [Root.GetTitledName]'s childhood, sent to [Root.GetHerHis] family in [Root.Liege.Capital.Capital.GetName], upon [Root.GetHerHis] death.
This looks like a personal notebook.

The collected writings of [Root.GetTitledName], documenting everything from travels in the [offmap_mexikha.GetFullName], to finding one's place in the [Root.Liege.GetCapitalHolding] of [Root.Liege.Capital.Capital.GetName], and [Root.Liege.Culture.GetName] court. And the family [Root.GetSheHe] built there.

If you no longer require the §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§!'s antilytron, you can choose to stop supplying horses to them. You will be unable to start supplying horses again with this character.
column3: Si n'avez plus besoin de la Grâce de §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§!, vous pouvez choisir de ne plus l'approvisionner en chevaux. Il vous sera impossible de le refaire avec ce personnage.
column4: Wenn Ihr die Gunst von §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! nicht länger benötigt, könnt Ihr die Versorgung mit Pferden beenden. Ihr könnt dann allerdings mit diesem Charakter nicht wieder mit der Lieferung beginnen.
column6: Si ya no necesitas la gracia de §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§!, puedes dejar de suministrarle caballos. No podrás volver a suministrar caballos con este personaje.

column2: Is a courtier from Lost Colony

§Y[This.GetTitledName]§! will leave [This.GetHerHis] life at court and return home to the distant [offmap_mexikha.GetFullName].
